member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.SetAppSettings(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Sets the NameValueCollection that configuration settings are retrieved from when using the DefaultConfiguration static class. The default is ConfigurationManager.AppSettings;

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.SetAppSettings(System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Sets the NameValueCollection that configuration settings are retrieved from when using the DefaultConfiguration static class. The default is ConfigurationManager.AppSettings;

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.SetAppSettings
member.summary: Reset the inner appSettings to those provided by ConfigurationManager.AppSettings

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.SetConnectionStrings(System.Configuration.ConnectionStringSettingsCollection)
member.summary: Sets the ConnectionStringSettingsCollection that connection strings are retrieved from when using the DefaultConfiguration static class. The default is ConfigurationManager.ConnectionStrings.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.GetAppSetting(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Get the property value for the specified type. If the value is not found an empty string will be returned.
member.param: The Type to retrieve the property for
The property to retrieve a value for

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.GetAppSetting(System.String)
member.summary: Get the value of the specified key. If the value is not found an empty string will be returned.
member.param: The key name to return the value for.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.GetAppSetting(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get the value of the specified key. If the value is not found the specified default value will be returned.
member.param: The key name to return the value for.
The value that will be returned if the specified key is not found.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.GetConnectionString(System.String)
member.summary: Return the specified connection string from the default configuration file. If the value is not found a blank entry with the specified name will be added to the configuration file and an empty string will be returned.
member.param: The name of the connection string to retrieve

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.GetConnectionString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Return the specified connection string from the default configuration file. If the value is not found the specified default value will be added to the configuration file and that value will be returned.
member.param: The name of the connection string to retrieve
The value to return if the connection string is not found in the configuration file. This value will also be added to the configuration file.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.GetConnectionString(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return the specified connection string from the default confiruation file. If the value is not found the specified default value will be added to the configuration file and that value will be returned.
member.param: The name of the connection string to retrieve
The value to return if the connection string is not found in the configuration file. This value will also be added to the configuration file.
If true and the specified name is not found the specified default value will be added to the configuration file.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.SetProperties(System.Object)
member.summary: Set properties from the default config file. The config file should contain keys in the form TypeName.PropertyName, where TypeName is the name of the class and PropertyName is the name of the property to set

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.SetProperties(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set properties from the default config file. The config file should contain keys in the form TypeName.PropertyName, where TypeName is the name of the class and PropertyName is the name of the property to set
member.param: If required property isn't found in the default config throw an exception.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.CopyConfig(System.String)
member.summary: Copies the currently executing assembly's config file to the specified path.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.SetPropertiesByProxyInstance(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the properties of the target instance that match the property names of the specified proxy from the specified proxy instance.
member.param: The instance to set the properties for.
An instance of the proxy class to use.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.SetPropertiesByProxy(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the properties of the current instance that match the property names of the specified proxy from the default config file. The config file should contain keys in the form TypeName.PropertyName, where TypeName is the name of the proxy class and PropertyName is the name of the property to set on the current instance.
member.param: The instance to set the properties for.
An instance of the proxy class to use.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.SetPropertiesByProxy(System.Object,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the properties of the current instance that match the property names of the specified proxy from the default config file. The config file should contain keys in the form TypeName.PropertyName, where TypeName is the name of the proxy class and PropertyName is the name of the property to set on the current instance.
member.param: The instance to set the properties for.
An instance of the proxy class to use.
Throws an exception if target implements IHasRequiredProperties and not all required properties have been set. The overrided default is false.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.SetPropertiesByProxy(System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Sets the properties of the specified target that match the property names of the specified proxy from the default config file. The config file should contain keys in the form TypeName.PropertyName, where TypeName is the name of the proxy class and PropertyName is the name of the property to set on the target.
member.param: The instance to set the properties for.
The type of the proxy to use.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.SetPropertiesByProxy(System.Object,System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the properties of the specified target that match the property names of the specified proxy from the default config file. The config file should contain keys in the form TypeName.PropertyName, where TypeName is the name of the proxy class and PropertyName is the name of the property to set on the target.
member.param: The instance to set the properties for.
The type of the proxy to use.
Throws an exception if target implements IHasRequiredProperties and not all required properties have been set. The overrided default is false.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.CopyProperties(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Copies properties that match in name and type from source to destination.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.CheckRequiredProperties(Brevitee.Configuration.IHasRequiredProperties)
member.summary: Checks the properties named in the RequiredProperties property of the specified IHasRequiredProperties object ensuring that each has been set. This method will throw an error if any required property is null or an empty string.
member.param: The IHasRequiredProperties implementation to check.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.CheckRequiredProperties(Brevitee.Configuration.IHasRequiredProperties,System.Type)
member.summary: Checks the properties named in the RequiredProperties property of the specified IHasRequiredProperties object ensuring that each has been set. This method will throw an error if required properties have not been set.
member.param: The IHasRequiredProperties implementation to check.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.InvokeConfigMethods(System.Object)
member.summary: Invokes methods declared in the appSettings section of the default configuration file.
member.param: The object instance to invoke methods on
member.remarks: The keys should be in the format <Type.Name>.InvokeMethod.<MethodName>.<Order as int>. For example: PatternsDatabaseSetupPermissionsInfo.InvokeMethod.AddStandardDbOwnerGroup.0. The trailing number determines the order of invocation relative to all other method invocations from configuration. The values should be a comma separated list of string parameters to be passed to the method upon invocation. Any additional spaces in the comma separated list of values will not be trimmed so the invoked methods should handle that possibility accordingly.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfiguration.InvokeConfigMethods(System.Object,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Invokes methods declared in the specified appSettingDictionary.
member.param: The object instance to invoke methods on
A dictionary of methods to invoke along with the parameter values.
member.remarks: The dictionary keys should be in the format <Type.Name>.InvokeMethod.<MethodName>.<Order as int>. For example: PatternsDatabaseSetupPermissionsInfo.InvokeMethod.AddStandardDbOwnerGroup.0. The trailing number determines the order of invocation relative to all other method invocations from configuration. The values should be a comma separated list of string parameters to be passed to the method upon invocation. Any additional spaces in the comma separated list of values will not be trimmed so the invoked methods should handle that possibility accordingly.

member.name: T:Brevitee.Configuration.DefaultConfigurer
member.summary: Configures IConfigurables by using DefaultConfiguration

member.name: T:Brevitee.Configuration.IHasRequiredProperties
member.summary: This interface is intended to be implemented by classes who wish to use the DefaultConfiguration class and CascadeConfiguration class to set its properties.

member.name: P:Brevitee.Configuration.IHasRequiredProperties.RequiredProperties
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class should return an array of strings containing the name of each property of the object which is required to be set prior to execution.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Logging.ILoggable.Subscribe(Brevitee.Logging.ILogger)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, subscribes the specified logger to log the inner events of the derived class.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Logging.ILoggable.IsSubscribed(Brevitee.Logging.ILogger)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, should return true if the specified logger is already subscribed

member.name: M:Brevitee.Logging.Loggable.Subscribe(Brevitee.Logging.ILogger)
member.summary: Subscribe the specified logger to all the events of the current type where the event delegate is defined as an EventHandler. This method will also take into account the current value of LogVerbosity if the events found are addorned with the Verbosity attribute

member.name: M:Brevitee.Logging.Loggable.IsSubscribed(Brevitee.Logging.ILogger)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified logger is subscribed to the current Loggable

member.name: P:Brevitee.Logging.Loggable.LogVerbosity
member.summary: A value from 0 - 5, represented by the LogEventType enum. The higher the value the more log entries will be logged.

member.name: P:Brevitee.Logging.Loggable.Subscribers
member.summary: An array of all the ILoggers that have been subscribed to this Loggable

member.name: T:Brevitee.Logging.VerbosityLevel
member.summary: The same values as LogEventType. Both exist for clarity in specific contexts.

member.name: T:Brevitee.IpcMessage
member.summary: A file based IPC mechanism that doesn't use, MSMQ, NamedPipes or MMF (MemoryMappedFiles). Uses a single file with a binary formatted copy of an instance of T in the directory RootDirectory with the name specified.

member.name: T:Brevitee.Logging.TextFileLogger
member.summary: A logger used to log events to a text file

member.name: M:Brevitee.Logging.Logger.BlockUntilEventQueueIsEmpty
member.summary: Blocks the current thread until the event queue is empty. Keep in mind that other calls to AddEntry by other threads will increment the number of events in the queue. This will abort the logging thread if it's running and call a 3 second Join (Join(3000)) on the thread to allow it to die.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Logging.Logger.CommitLogEvent(Brevitee.Logging.LogEvent)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class will commit the specified logEvent to the underlying storage for the current Logger implementation.

member.summary: Returns an id for the specified applicationName and messageSignature.

member.name: P:Brevitee.Logging.Logger.Verbosity
member.summary: A number indicating what level of verbosity to log. The default is 4.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Logging.TextFileLogger.CommitLogEvent(Brevitee.Logging.LogEvent)
member.summary: Writes the specified logEvent to the file referenced by the File property of the current TextFileLogger.

member.summary: Increments the file number if the current file number already exists.

member.summary: Gets the path to the current user's AppData folder. If this is run in a Web app (HttpContext.Current isn't null) then the full path to ~/AppData/ is returned.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of any single log file created by this logger. No effect if XmlLogger, use MaxEntries instead.

member.summary: Gets or sets the directory where logs are written

member.name: P:Brevitee.Logging.TextFileLogger.File

member.summary: Read the first line of the string returning the remainder and outing the line. A line is defined as a sequence of characters followed by a line feed ("\n"), a carriage return ("\r"), or a carriage return immediately followed by a line feed ("\r\n").

member.summary: Reset Log.Current to null. Used primarily for testing.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Logging.Log.AddEntry(System.String,System.Diagnostics.EventLogEntryType,System.String[])
member.summary: Convenience method for passing in System.Diagnostics.EventLogEntryType instead of LogEventType. The specified EventLogEntryType will be converted to an equivalent LogEventType if necessary.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Logging.Log.BlockUntilEventQueueIsEmpty
member.summary: Blocks the current thread until the event queue is empty. Keep in mind that other calls to AddEntry by other threads will increment the number of events in the queue. If the commit thread is running it will be restarted.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Logging.Log.Start
member.summary: Starts the background logging commit thread.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Logging.Log.Stop
member.summary: Stops the background logging commit thread.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Logging.Log.AbandonQueue
member.summary: Flushes the current LogEvent queue without committing them. May throw an InvalidCastException if the ILogger implementation referenced by Log.Default doesn't extend Logger.

member.name: T:Brevitee.Logging.LogEventCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of LogEvents that can be persisted to a file.

member.name: P:Brevitee.Logging.LogEventCollection.EventLogEntries
member.summary: Gets or sets the LogEvent array that constitute this LogEventCollection

member.name: T:Brevitee.Logging.LogEventType
member.summary: The same values as Verbosity level. Both exist for clarity in specific contexts.

member.name: T:Brevitee.Logging.MultiTargetLogger
member.summary: The type of logger that Log.Default will be set to if AddLogger is called. Commit() implementation only calls Commit on each logger that has been added through the AddLogger method. This class is not intended to be used directly.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Logging.MultiTargetLogger.AddLogger(Brevitee.Logging.ILogger)
member.summary: Adds the specified logger if it hasn't already been added. If the specified logger is the current MultiTargetLogger it will not be added. If the specified logger is a NullLoger it will not be added.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Logging.MultiTargetLogger.CommitLogEvent(Brevitee.Logging.LogEvent)
member.summary: Passes the specified logEvent to the Commit method of each of the ILoggers in Loggers.

member.name: P:Brevitee.Logging.MultiTargetLogger.Loggers
member.summary: An array of all the loggers currently added to this MultiTargetLogger

member.summary: The Brevitee.Logging namespace contains classes, interfaces and value types used to aide in log management.

member.name: T:Brevitee.Logging.WindowsLogger
member.summary: An LoggerBase implementation that commits logs to the Windows event viewer.

member.name: T:Brevitee.MethodCase
member.summary: Determines whether generated JavaScript methods will be camel case (camel has his head down; first letter lowercase) or pascal case

member.name: T:Brevitee.Providers
member.summary: Type safe way of getting session level singletons. Safer than using the Session object because it doesn't use magic strings and optionally allows for the object to be set once only without being overwritten.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Providers.SetSessionProviderIfNull``1(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the session provider if it has not been set yet.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Providers.SetSessionProvider``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Sets the session provider of Type T to the specified concrete instance provider. The generic argument T "should" be an interface so different implementations can be set and used for testing.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Providers.SetSessionProvider``1(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the session provider of Type T to the specified concrete instance provider. The generic argument T "should" be an interface so different implementations can be set and used for testing.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Providers.GetSessionProvider``1
member.summary: Gets a provider of the specified type T for the current session.
member.typeparam: The type implemented by the object to return. This can be an interface an abstract class or any type in the inheritance hierarchy of the stored object.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Providers.GetSessionProvider``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets a provider of the specified type T for the current session. If it hasn't been set yet it will be set to the instance provided. Once set it cannot be set again.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Providers.GetSessionProvider``1(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a provider of the specified type T for the current session. If it hasn't been set yet it will be set to the instance provided. Once set it can only be set again if allowOverWrite is true.
member.typeparam: The type implemented by the object to return. This can be an interface an abstract class or any type in the inheritance hierarchy of the stored object.
member.param: The instance to set the session provider to if it has not already been set.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Providers.SetApplicationProvider``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Set a singleton instance provider of the generic type T. Can only be called once per type T.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Providers.SetApplicationProvider``1(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set a singleton instance provider of the generic type T. Can only be called again if allowOverwrite is true.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Providers.GetApplicationProvider``1
member.summary: Get a singleton instance provider of the generic type T. If not currently set it will be set to the object provided. Once set the application provider of the specified type cannot be set to a different instance.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Providers.GetApplicationProvider``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Get a singleton instance provider of the generic type T. If not currently set it will be set to the object provided. Once set the application provider of the specified type cannot be set to a different instance.

member.name: M:Brevitee.Providers.GetApplicationSingleton``1
member.summary: Gets a singleton of the specified generic type. If the singleton hasn't been set a new instance will be created using the default constructor.

member.name: M:Brevitee.ServiceExe.ProcessCommandLineArgs(System.String[])
member.summary:
Returns true if there were recognized command line arguments to be processed otherwise false. Not to be confused with the command line arguments intended for CommandLineInterface implementations. This method will process service related comand line arguments. A call to SetInfo should be made prior to this call to ensure all ServiceInfo is already set.
Valid values are:
-i [-ck:{credentialKey}] Install the current ServiceExe implementation as a service. Using the specified appSettings key to look for credentials in the config file. Expected keys would be key="{credentialKey}" and key="{credentialKey}Password". Values will be retrieved using DefaultConfiguration
-i [true] Install the current ServiceExe implementation as a service allowing desktop interaction. Cannot be combined with -ck option.
-s Start the service
-k Kill (stop) the service
-r Restart the service (stop and start)
-u Uninstall the service
-dl [-f] Delete the log. Specify -f to force deletion without prompting to confirm

member.name: M:Brevitee.ServiceExe.SetInfo(Brevitee.ServiceInfo)
member.summary: Set the ServiceName, DisplayName and Description for the current service.

member.name: M:Brevitee.ServiceExe.CreateLog
member.summary: Creates a Windows event log for the extender of ServiceExe. serviceName must be defined.

The number of seconds to allow the function to execute before returning true

member.name: M:Brevitee.UserUtil.StripDomain(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value at index 1 after splitting the specified name at the backslash character (\). If there are no backslash characters the full value is returned.

member.name: M:Brevitee.UserUtil.GetCurrentUser
member.summary: Returns the current user of the application. If this method is called from a web application the current web user is returned, otherwise the name of the owner of the current process is returned.

member.name: M:Brevitee.UserUtil.GetCurrentUser(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the current user of the application. If this method is called from a web application the current web user is returned, otherwise the name of the owner of the current process is returned.

member.name: M:Brevitee.UserUtil.GetCurrentWindowsUser(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the current Windows user. This is typically the owner of the currently running process.
member.param: True to return <domain>\<userName>, if false <userName>

member.name: M:Brevitee.UserUtil.GetCurrentWindowsUserDomain
member.summary: Gets the domain of the current Windows user. The current Windows user is typically the owner of the currently running process.
member.returns: The domain of the current Windows user.

member.name: M:Brevitee.UserUtil.GetCurrentUserDomain
member.summary: Gets the domain of the current user. If running in a web app the web user's domain is returned otherwise the domain of the current windows user is returned.
